content:
The pull requests add the construction of a Sylow group of a finite group as a subgroup with the right cardinality. In some sense its an inverse to sylow.card_eq_multiplicity. See also the previous discussion.

I decided to not add the lemma set_like.eq_of_subset_of_card_le, as it is just the composition of set_like'.extand set.eq_of_subset_of_card_le. Also, the best place to put it might have been data.set_like.finiteand this file is apparently in the process of being ported to lean4.
What is the status now of the pull request, is there anything else I should do at this point? @Thomas Browning @Yaël Dillies
CI doesn't pass. Can you fix the errors?
I think I fixed the previous CI errors, hopefully the rest will pass as well
I see no change to the PR. Have you pushed?
Yes
See this change.
Is there still something I should do @Yaël Dillies ?
Sorry, no time now! I will be out of exams in two days
No worries, good luck with your exams!
@Bernhard Reinke You should merge master, since I think this file has been synchronized with mathlib4 in the meantime

Now that the file has been synchronized, I should also then create a PR for mathlib4 right? I am not sure whether this PR is worth messing with the porting process, I can wait until the port is complete
You can have a look at #port-guide. In any case you should wait to open a mathlib4 PR
Can you please merge master into your PR to get the comment THIS FILE IS SYNCHRONIZED WITH MATHLIB4.? Thanks!
OK, I just merged master.
The CI timed out because of the merge, I rebased to master, this seems to have helped to pick the right cache
What is the status now @Yaël Dillies ? It should be fine for the freeze right?
Will have a look in an hour
So what do you think?
Did you managed to have a look @Yaël Dillies ?
It seems like @Kyle Miller and @Thomas Browning already reviewed this PR, right? I wonder if that's enough to get it in before the freeze.
@Bernhard Reinke @Mauricio Collares I missed Thomas's message to me on GitHub. I just merged it.
It is now merged to master, so now I should start creating a mathlib4 PR following #port-guide, right?
Ok, here is my pull request for the port !4#5831, CI already passes.
